subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: On PALM
msgSnippet: ... That means we have to type an extra character when we type, something pretty unnatural. Also, that means letters are dependent on the ligature table, which
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:

>
> There are two special Unicode characters, U+200D to place between two
> characters to encourage them to ligature if they can, and U+200C
> to prevent ligaturing. These can be put in the ligature table
> so that e.g. U+xxxx U+200D U+yyyy triggers a ligature of xxxx and yyyy.
>

That means we have to type an extra character when we type, something
pretty unnatural. Also, that means letters are dependent on the ligature
table, which may or may not be read by certain applications. For
example, I've come across only two applications that read in my kerning
table, TeX and Indesign. Word doesn't, OO doesn't, none of the browsers
do. So I don't want to be dependent on a ligature table in order for a
certain character to appear. If we are so dependent, surely we will
become frustrated when we are typing something and we can't get what we
want.

Paul
